meanings.definition: Having or displaying an excessively critical point of view.
meanings.sent1: She is always judgemental about other people's choices.
meanings.sent2: It is not nice to be judgemental towards others.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat looked judgemental when I spilled my drink.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed judgemental as they loomed overhead.
meanings.sent5: His judgemental tone made everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: Involving the use of judgment or discernment.
meanings.sent1: The judgemental decision was made after careful consideration.
meanings.sent2: She made a judgemental choice based on the available information.
meanings.sent3: The judgemental squirrel carefully selected the best acorn.
meanings.sent4: The judgemental eyes of the owl scanned the forest for prey.
meanings.sent5: His judgemental gaze seemed to see right through me.

meanings.definition: Tending to form opinions or make decisions based on personal preferences rather than objective facts.
meanings.sent1: Her judgemental nature often clouds her judgment.
meanings.sent2: Being judgemental can lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The judgemental ice cream flavor was her favorite, regardless of reviews.
meanings.sent4: The judgemental compass always pointed towards what she liked.
meanings.sent5: His judgemental mind refused to consider any other options.
